noun.description: A simplified form of English spelling devised by the Swedish philologist R. E. Zachrisson (1880–1937), and intended for use as an auxiliary orthography for learners of English.

adjective.description: Of or relating to the Angles, the Anglian kingdoms, or their languages; = "Anglian".

origin: 1930s. From angl- (in Anglo-) + -ic<br>late 18th century; earliest use found in John Pinkerton (1758–1826), historian and poet. From post-classical Latin Anglicus English from classical Latin Anglus + -icus.
